bitwarden.name: Bitwarden
use_cases: Best for people who want a standalone, dedicated password manager that syncs easily across devices with an established history
pros: Built-in templates to store data like notes, credit cards, identity information, and more

keepass.name: KeePassXC
use_cases: Best for people who distrust the cloud and want someting entirely local
pros: No paid plans, everything is 100% free
Multiple clients compatible with the vault's .kdbx format allows users to easily migrate to another similar app for any reason, such as different feature sets or user interface
See [here](https://keepass.info/download.html) for a list of other compatibile clients
Certain clients (such as KeePassDX) available on F-Droid
cons: Other clients may not have the same features (audits, F-Droid availibility, passkey support, etc)
No built-in templates for other forms of data such as credit card or notes
See [here](https://keepass.info/download.html) for a list of other compatibile clients

protonpass.name: Proton Pass
use_cases: Best for people who prefer an all-in-one ecosystem (similar to Google Suite or Apple iCloud) because it includes cloud storage, calendar, mail, VPN, and more
pros: Built-in templates to store data like notes, credit cards, identity information, and more
Comes with free calendar, cloud storage, email, and VPN as part of a Proton account
